When I joined Tumblr, I was blown away by what it meant to work at true scale. Millions of users. Countless data points. Infrastructure pushed to its limits. At that level, most off-the-shelf tools simply break. What works elsewhere doesn’t cut it here — and the people who make it all run are some of the smartest, most dedicated folks I’ve ever met.This morning, some of those incredible colleagues were laid off.These aren’t just great engineers, PMs, researchers, marketers, and data scientists — they’re thoughtful, creative problem-solvers who built systems that most teams will never even encounter in their careers. They care deeply about their craft and about the people they build for.If you're hiring — or even just open to a conversation — I’d love to connect you. I will personally vouch for them.DM me. Let’s get these folks back where they belong: building great things.

Deactivate user accounts as needed. Implement and manage account permissions to ensure users have appropriate access levels. Process account creation and reactivation request by thoroughly vetting the form and shepherding the form through approvers and stakeholders. Change Management (CM): Receive and process draft Change Requests (CRs) from HEITS Engineers and Project Managers. Submit CRs to the appropriate Security teams for review and assist in mitigating any discrepancy or additional details required by Security teams. Submit CRs to the C-ICCB for review and mitigate any findings identified by C-ICCB. Input and submit required documentation and approval verification into the appropriate ticketing system, working the CR through the ticketing system workflow until closed. Provide for weekly, monthly, and ad hoc metrics and/or reporting as requested by System Owners, HEITS, Security, and C-ICCB teams. Submit and process Emergency Break Fix (EBFs), Emergency Change Request (ECRs), and extension requests as needed. Audit and verify tasks are completed as outlined in change request documentation. They care deeply about their craft and about the people they build for.If you're hiring — or even just open to a conversation — I’d love to connect you. I will personally vouch for them.DM me. hashtag#hiring *Service Desk Analyst with Security Clearance*, Bay Saint Louis, *United States*, $50/hr, fulltime hashtag#opentowork $50/hr hashtag#BaySaintLouisjobs hashtag#Mississippijobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#corptocorp hashtag#c2c hashtag#corp2corp hashtag#contractjobs hashtag#contractor hashtag#contractwork *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/dSbnJi6a Service Desk AnalystLocation: Stennis Space Center, MississippiSchedule (FT/PT): Full TimeClearance: Top Secret1099/C2C Opportunity Only: $45-$50 /hr Primary ResponsibilitiesPrimary tasks required: Become an integral part of the support services team. This includes tasks that include but are not limited to:Homeland Connection Approval Office (HCAO): Create user accounts in active directory. Maintains user account with accurate data. Deactivate user accounts as needed. Implement and manage account permissions to ensure users have appropriate access levels. Process account creation and reactivation request by thoroughly vetting the form and shepherding the form through approvers and stakeholders. Collaborate with various teams to establish and enforce DHS policies, procedures, and best practices. Participate in audits and review of active directory to identify potential risks. Maintain up-to-date documentation for HCAO processes and procedures. Process account creation forms and approvals. Manage a shared mailbox with team members to address questions and concerns from the user community. Change Management (CM): Receive and process draft Change Requests (CRs) from HEITS Engineers and Project Managers. Collaborate with sending teams or individuals to finalize CRs per standards that are established by System Owners, Security, and Classified Infrastructure Change Control Board (C-ICCB) policies. Submit CRs to the appropriate Security teams for review and assist in mitigating any discrepancy or additional details required by Security teams. Submit CRs to the C-ICCB for review and mitigate any findings identified by C-ICCB. Input and submit required documentation and approval verification into the appropriate ticketing system, working the CR through the ticketing system workflow until closed. Provide for weekly, monthly, and ad hoc metrics and/or reporting as requested by System Owners, HEITS, Security, and C-ICCB teams. Submit and process Emergency Break Fix (EBFs), Emergency Change Request (ECRs), and extension requests as needed. Audit and verify tasks are completed as outlined in change request documentation. Maintenance, support, and sustainment of applicable databases.Additional tasks that could be assigned include: HEITS Business Request team daily tasks. Update BR tracking and coordinate with BR stakeholders. Assist in Remedy and SNOW admin request. Clearance Required: Top Secret Basic QualificationsRequires 2+ years of prior, relevant experience.Exceptional proficiency with Microsoft Office products.Ability to work directly with customers, engineers, and project manager

This includes tasks that include but are not limited to:Homeland Connection Approval Office (HCAO): Create user accounts in active directory. Maintains user account with accurate data. Deactivate user accounts as needed. Implement and manage account permissions to ensure users have appropriate access levels. Process account creation and reactivation request by thoroughly vetting the form and shepherding the form through approvers and stakeholders. Collaborate with various teams to establish and enforce DHS policies, procedures, and best practices. Participate in audits and review of active directory to identify potential risks. Maintain up-to-date documentation for HCAO processes and procedures. Process account creation forms and approvals. Manage a shared mailbox with team members to address questions and concerns from the user community. Change Management (CM): Receive and process draft Change Requests (CRs) from HEITS Engineers and Project Managers. Collaborate with sending teams or individuals to finalize CRs per standards that are established by System Owners, Security, and Classified Infrastructure Change Control Board (C-ICCB) policies. Submit CRs to the appropriate Security teams for review and assist in mitigating any discrepancy or additional details required by Security teams. Submit CRs to the C-ICCB for review and mitigate any findings identified by C-ICCB. Input and submit required documentation and approval verification into the appropriate ticketing system, working the CR through the ticketing system workflow until closed. Provide for weekly, monthly, and ad hoc metrics and/or reporting as requested by System Owners, HEITS, Security, and C-ICCB teams. Submit and process Emergency Break Fix (EBFs), Emergency Change Request (ECRs), and extension requests as needed. Audit and verify tasks are completed as outlined in change request documentation. Maintenance, support, and sustainment of applicable databases.Additional tasks that could be assigned include: HEITS Business Request team daily tasks. Update BR tracking and coordinate with BR stakeholders. Assist in Remedy and SNOW admin request. At that level, most off-the-shelf tools simply break. What works elsewhere doesn’t cut it here — and the people who make it all run are some of the smartest, most dedicated folks I’ve ever met.This morning, some of those incredible colleagues were laid off.These aren’t just great engineers, PMs, researchers, marketers, and data scientists — they’re thoughtful, creative problem-solvers who built systems that most teams will never even encounter in their careers. They care deeply about their craft and about the people they build for.If you're hiring — or even just open to a conversation — I’d love to connect you. I will personally vouch for them.DM me. Let’s get these folks back where they belong: building great things.

This includes tasks that include but are not limited to:Homeland Connection Approval Office (HCAO): Create user accounts in active directory. Maintains user account with accurate data. Deactivate user accounts as needed. Implement and manage account permissions to ensure users have appropriate access levels. Process account creation and reactivation request by thoroughly vetting the form and shepherding the form through approvers and stakeholders. Maintain up-to-date documentation for HCAO processes and procedures. Process account creation forms and approvals. Change Management (CM): Receive and process draft Change Requests (CRs) from HEITS Engineers and Project Managers. Collaborate with sending teams or individuals to finalize CRs per standards that are established by System Owners, Security, and Classified Infrastructure Change Control Board (C-ICCB) policies. Submit CRs to the appropriate Security teams for review and assist in mitigating any discrepancy or additional details required by Security teams. Submit CRs to the C-ICCB for review and mitigate any findings identified by C-ICCB. Input and submit required documentation and approval verification into the appropriate ticketing system, working the CR through the ticketing system workflow until closed. Provide for weekly, monthly, and ad hoc metrics and/or reporting as requested by System Owners, HEITS, Security, and C-ICCB teams. Submit and process Emergency Break Fix (EBFs), Emergency Change Request (ECRs), and extension requests as needed. Audit and verify tasks are completed as outlined in change request documentation. Maintenance, support, and sustainment of applicable databases.Additional tasks that could be assigned include: HEITS Business Request team daily tasks. Update BR tracking and coordinate with BR stakeholders. Assist in Remedy and SNOW admin request. They care deeply about their craft and about the people they build for.If you're hiring — or even just open to a conversation — I’d love to connect you. I will personally vouch for them.DM me. hashtag#hiring *Service Desk Analyst with Security Clearance*, Bay Saint Louis, *United States*, $50/hr, fulltime hashtag#opentowork $50/hr hashtag#BaySaintLouisjobs hashtag#Mississippijobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#corptocorp hashtag#c2c hashtag#corp2corp hashtag#contractjobs hashtag#contractor hashtag#contractwork *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/dSbnJi6a Service Desk AnalystLocation: Stennis Space Center, MississippiSchedule (FT/PT): Full TimeClearance: Top Secret1099/C2C Opportunity Only: $45-$50 /hr Primary ResponsibilitiesPrimary tasks required: Become an integral part of the support services team. This includes tasks that include but are not limited to:Homeland Connection Approval Office (HCAO): Create user accounts in active directory. Maintains user account with accurate data. Deactivate user accounts as needed. Implement and manage account permissions to ensure users have appropriate access levels. Process account creation and reactivation request by thoroughly vetting the form and shepherding the form through approvers and stakeholders. Collaborate with various teams to establish and enforce DHS policies, procedures, and best practices. Participate in audits and review of active directory to identify potential risks. Maintain up-to-date documentation for HCAO processes and procedures. Process account creation forms and approvals. Manage a shared mailbox with team members to address questions and concerns from the user community. Change Management (CM): Receive and process draft Change Requests (CRs) from HEITS Engineers and Project Managers. Collaborate with sending teams or individuals to finalize CRs per standards that are established by System Owners, Security, and Classified Infrastructure Change Control Board (C-ICCB) policies. Submit CRs to the appropriate Security teams for review and assist in mitigating any discrepancy or additional details required by Security teams. Submit CRs to the C-ICCB for review and mitigate any findings identified by C-ICCB. Input and submit required documentation and approval verification into the appropriate ticketing system, working the CR through the ticketing system workflow until closed. Provide for weekly, monthly, and ad hoc metrics and/or reporting as requested by System Owners, HEITS, Security, and C-ICCB teams. Submit and process Emergency Break Fix (EBFs), Emergency Change Request (ECRs), and extension requests as needed. Audit and verify tasks are completed as outlined in change request documentation. Maintenance, support, and sustainment of applicable databases.Additional tasks that could be assigned include: HEITS Business Request team daily tasks. Update BR tracking and coordinate with BR stakeholders. Assist in Remedy and SNOW admin request. Clearance Required: Top Secret Basic QualificationsRequires 2+ years of prior, relevant experience.Exceptional proficiency with Microsoft Office products.Ability to work directly with customers, engineers, and project manager

When I joined Tumblr, I was blown away by what it meant to work at true scale. Millions of users. Countless data points. Infrastructure pushed to its limits. At that level, most off-the-shelf tools simply break. What works elsewhere doesn’t cut it here — and the people who make it all run are some of the smartest, most dedicated folks I’ve ever met.This morning, some of those incredible colleagues were laid off.These aren’t just great engineers, PMs, researchers, marketers, and data scientists — they’re thoughtful, creative problem-solvers who built systems that most teams will never even encounter in their careers. They care deeply about their craft and about the people they build for.If you're hiring — or even just open to a conversation — I’d love to connect you. I will personally vouch for them.DM me. Let’s get these folks back where they belong: building great things.

hashtag#hiring *Service Desk Analyst with Security Clearance*, Bay Saint Louis, *United States*, $50/hr, fulltime hashtag#opentowork $50/hr hashtag#BaySaintLouisjobs hashtag#Mississippijobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#corptocorp hashtag#c2c hashtag#corp2corp hashtag#contractjobs hashtag#contractor hashtag#contractwork *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/dSbnJi6a Service Desk AnalystLocation: Stennis Space Center, MississippiSchedule (FT/PT): Full TimeClearance: Top Secret1099/C2C Opportunity Only: $45-$50 /hr Primary ResponsibilitiesPrimary tasks required: Become an integral part of the support services team. This includes tasks that include but are not limited to:Homeland Connection Approval Office (HCAO): Create user accounts in active directory. Maintains user account with accurate data. Deactivate user accounts as needed. Implement and manage account permissions to ensure users have appropriate access levels. Process account creation and reactivation request by thoroughly vetting the form and shepherding the form through approvers and stakeholders. Collaborate with various teams to establish and enforce DHS policies, procedures, and best practices. Participate in audits and review of active directory to identify potential risks. Maintain up-to-date documentation for HCAO processes and procedures. Process account creation forms and approvals. Manage a shared mailbox with team members to address questions and concerns from the user community. Change Management (CM): Receive and process draft Change Requests (CRs) from HEITS Engineers and Project Managers. Collaborate with sending teams or individuals to finalize CRs per standards that are established by System Owners, Security, and Classified Infrastructure Change Control Board (C-ICCB) policies. Submit CRs to the appropriate Security teams for review and assist in mitigating any discrepancy or additional details required by Security teams. Submit CRs to the C-ICCB for review and mitigate any findings identified by C-ICCB. Input and submit required documentation and approval verification into the appropriate ticketing system, working the CR through the ticketing system workflow until closed. Provide for weekly, monthly, and ad hoc metrics and/or reporting as requested by System Owners, HEITS, Security, and C-ICCB teams. Submit and process Emergency Break Fix (EBFs), Emergency Change Request (ECRs), and extension requests as needed. Audit and verify tasks are completed as outlined in change request documentation. Maintenance, support, and sustainment of applicable databases.Additional tasks that could be assigned include: HEITS Business Request team daily tasks. Update BR tracking and coordinate with BR stakeholders. Assist in Remedy and SNOW admin request. Clearance Required: Top Secret Basic QualificationsRequires 2+ years of prior, relevant experience.Exceptional proficiency with Microsoft Office products.Ability to work directly with customers, engineers, and project manager

When I joined Tumblr, I was blown away by what it meant to work at true scale. Millions of users. Countless data points. Infrastructure pushed to its limits. At that level, most off-the-shelf tools simply break. What works elsewhere doesn’t cut it here — and the people who make it all run are some of the smartest, most dedicated folks I’ve ever met.This morning, some of those incredible colleagues were laid off.These aren’t just great engineers, PMs, researchers, marketers, and data scientists — they’re thoughtful, creative problem-solvers who built systems that most teams will never even encounter in their careers. They care deeply about their craft and about the people they build for.If you're hiring — or even just open to a conversation — I’d love to connect you. I will personally vouch for them.DM me. Let’s get these folks back where they belong: building great things.

hashtag#hiring *Service Desk Analyst with Security Clearance*, Bay Saint Louis, *United States*, $50/hr, fulltime hashtag#opentowork $50/hr hashtag#BaySaintLouisjobs hashtag#Mississippijobs hashtag#ITCommunications hashtag#corptocorp hashtag#c2c hashtag#corp2corp hashtag#contractjobs hashtag#contractor hashtag#contractwork *To Apply -->*: https://lnkd.in/dSbnJi6a Service Desk AnalystLocation: Stennis Space Center, MississippiSchedule (FT/PT): Full TimeClearance: Top Secret1099/C2C Opportunity Only: $45-$50 /hr Primary ResponsibilitiesPrimary tasks required: Become an integral part of the support services team. This includes tasks that include but are not limited to:Homeland Connection Approval Office (HCAO): Create user accounts in active directory. Maintains user account with accurate data. Deactivate user accounts as needed. Implement and manage account permissions to ensure users have appropriate access levels. Process account creation and reactivation request by thoroughly vetting the form and shepherding the form through approvers and stakeholders. Collaborate with various teams to establish and enforce DHS policies, procedures, and best practices. Participate in audits and review of active directory to identify potential risks. Maintain up-to-date documentation for HCAO processes and procedures. Process account creation forms and approvals. Manage a shared mailbox with team members to address questions and concerns from the user community. Change Management (CM): Receive and process draft Change Requests (CRs) from HEITS Engineers and Project Managers. Collaborate with sending teams or individuals to finalize CRs per standards that are established by System Owners, Security, and Classified Infrastructure Change Control Board (C-ICCB) policies. Submit CRs to the appropriate Security teams for review and assist in mitigating any discrepancy or additional details required by Security teams. Submit CRs to the C-ICCB for review and mitigate any findings identified by C-ICCB. Input and submit required documentation and approval verification into the appropriate ticketing system, working the CR through the ticketing system workflow until closed. Provide for weekly, monthly, and ad hoc metrics and/or reporting as requested by System Owners, HEITS, Security, and C-ICCB teams. Submit and process Emergency Break Fix (EBFs), Emergency Change Request (ECRs), and extension requests as needed. Audit and verify tasks are completed as outlined in change request documentation. Maintenance, support, and sustainment of applicable databases.Additional tasks that could be assigned include: HEITS Business Request team daily tasks. Update BR tracking and coordinate with BR stakeholders. Assist in Remedy and SNOW admin request. Clearance Required: Top Secret Basic QualificationsRequires 2+ years of prior, relevant experience.Exceptional proficiency with Microsoft Office products.Ability to work directly with customers, engineers, and project manager

Because what’s a little anti-Indian sentiment between friends, right? Especially when your new boss is Elon Musk, whose definition of “government efficiency” seems to involve running HR through Reddit polls.Yes, after the nation bravely survived the trauma of Elez’s brief resignation, Musk asked Twitter if he should bring him back. The platform, known for its sober deliberations and civil discourse, overwhelmingly voted: “Sure, why not give the guy with ‘Normalize Indian hate’ posts another crack at the Treasury’s payment systems?”In a surprising twist, Vice President JD Vance (whose wife is Indian!) backed the return, stating, “Stupid social media activity shouldn’t ruin someone’s life.” It’s a brave stand for Vance—finally giving a voice to the voiceless: the persecuted class of software engineers who just can’t stop tweeting ethnic slurs.The Trump administration insists Elez now only has “read-only” access. That’s comforting. Because if there’s anything we’ve learned from tech bros, it’s that “read-only” access is always obeyed—just like speed limits in a rented McLaren.𝐓𝐫𝐮𝐦𝐩 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐦𝐢𝐬𝐞𝐝: “𝐖𝐞 𝐰𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐢𝐦𝐦𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐥𝐲 𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐠𝐫𝐢𝐭𝐲, 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐩𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐲, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐥𝐨𝐲𝐚𝐥𝐭𝐲 𝐨𝐟 𝐀𝐦𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐚’𝐬 𝐠𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐧𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭.”But like any good tech product, you’ve got to read the fine print: “Terms and conditions apply. Because what’s a little anti-Indian sentiment between friends, right? Especially when your new boss is Elon Musk, whose definition of “government efficiency” seems to involve running HR through Reddit polls.Yes, after the nation bravely survived the trauma of Elez’s brief resignation, Musk asked Twitter if he should bring him back. The platform, known for its sober deliberations and civil discourse, overwhelmingly voted: “Sure, why not give the guy with ‘Normalize Indian hate’ posts another crack at the Treasury’s payment systems?”In a surprising twist, Vice President JD Vance (whose wife is Indian!) backed the return, stating, “Stupid social media activity shouldn’t ruin someone’s life.” It’s a brave stand for Vance—finally giving a voice to the voiceless: the persecuted class of software engineers who just can’t stop tweeting ethnic slurs.The Trump administration insists Elez now only has “read-only” access. That’s comforting. Because if there’s anything we’ve learned from tech bros, it’s that “read-only” access is always obeyed—just like speed limits in a rented McLaren.𝐓𝐫𝐮𝐦𝐩 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐦𝐢𝐬𝐞𝐝: “𝐖𝐞 𝐰𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐢𝐦𝐦𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐥𝐲 𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐠𝐫𝐢𝐭𝐲, 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐩𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐲, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐥𝐨𝐲𝐚𝐥𝐭𝐲 𝐨𝐟 𝐀𝐦𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐚’𝐬 𝐠𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐧𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭.”But like any good tech product, you’ve got to read the fine print: “Terms and conditions apply. Because what’s a little anti-Indian sentiment between friends, right? Especially when your new boss is Elon Musk, whose definition of “government efficiency” seems to involve running HR through Reddit polls.Yes, after the nation bravely survived the trauma of Elez’s brief resignation, Musk asked Twitter if he should bring him back. The platform, known for its sober deliberations and civil discourse, overwhelmingly voted: “Sure, why not give the guy with ‘Normalize Indian hate’ posts another crack at the Treasury’s payment systems?”In a surprising twist, Vice President JD Vance (whose wife is Indian!) backed the return, stating, “Stupid social media activity shouldn’t ruin someone’s life.” It’s a brave stand for Vance—finally giving a voice to the voiceless: the persecuted class of software engineers who just can’t stop tweeting ethnic slurs.The Trump administration insists Elez now only has “read-only” access. That’s comforting. Because what’s a little anti-Indian sentiment between friends, right? Especially when your new boss is Elon Musk, whose definition of “government efficiency” seems to involve running HR through Reddit polls.Yes, after the nation bravely survived the trauma of Elez’s brief resignation, Musk asked Twitter if he should bring him back. The platform, known for its sober deliberations and civil discourse, overwhelmingly voted: “Sure, why not give the guy with ‘Normalize Indian hate’ posts another crack at the Treasury’s payment systems?”In a surprising twist, Vice President JD Vance (whose wife is Indian!) backed the return, stating, “Stupid social media activity shouldn’t ruin someone’s life.” It’s a brave stand for Vance—finally giving a voice to the voiceless: the persecuted class of software engineers who just can’t stop tweeting ethnic slurs.The Trump administration insists Elez now only has “read-only” access. That’s comforting. Because if there’s anything we’ve learned from tech bros, it’s that “read-only” access is always obeyed—just like speed limits in a rented McLaren.𝐓𝐫𝐮𝐦𝐩 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐦𝐢𝐬𝐞𝐝: “𝐖𝐞 𝐰𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐢𝐦𝐦𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐥𝐲 𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐠𝐫𝐢𝐭𝐲, 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐩𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐲, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐥𝐨𝐲𝐚𝐥𝐭𝐲 𝐨𝐟 𝐀𝐦𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐚’𝐬 𝐠𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐧𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭.”But like any good tech product, you’ve got to read the fine print: “Terms and conditions apply. Offer not valid for minorities, career professionals, or anyone who’s ever read the Constitution.”This satirical summary was written by an AI, because when your government’s hiring policy sounds like a prank post from 4chan, it’s only fair your news gets written by a chatbot.https://lnkd.in/gu3D9KSg

Because what’s a little anti-Indian sentiment between friends, right? Especially when your new boss is Elon Musk, whose definition of “government efficiency” seems to involve running HR through Reddit polls.Yes, after the nation bravely survived the trauma of Elez’s brief resignation, Musk asked Twitter if he should bring him back. The platform, known for its sober deliberations and civil discourse, overwhelmingly voted: “Sure, why not give the guy with ‘Normalize Indian hate’ posts another crack at the Treasury’s payment systems?”In a surprising twist, Vice President JD Vance (whose wife is Indian!) backed the return, stating, “Stupid social media activity shouldn’t ruin someone’s life.” It’s a brave stand for Vance—finally giving a voice to the voiceless: the persecuted class of software engineers who just can’t stop tweeting ethnic slurs.The Trump administration insists Elez now only has “read-only” access. That’s comforting. Because if there’s anything we’ve learned from tech bros, it’s that “read-only” access is always obeyed—just like speed limits in a rented McLaren.𝐓𝐫𝐮𝐦𝐩 𝐩𝐫𝐨𝐦𝐢𝐬𝐞𝐝: “𝐖𝐞 𝐰𝐢𝐥𝐥 𝐢𝐦𝐦𝐞𝐝𝐢𝐚𝐭𝐞𝐥𝐲 𝐫𝐞𝐬𝐭𝐨𝐫𝐞 𝐭𝐡𝐞 𝐢𝐧𝐭𝐞𝐠𝐫𝐢𝐭𝐲, 𝐜𝐨𝐦𝐩𝐞𝐭𝐞𝐧𝐜𝐲, 𝐚𝐧𝐝 𝐥𝐨𝐲𝐚𝐥𝐭𝐲 𝐨𝐟 𝐀𝐦𝐞𝐫𝐢𝐜𝐚’𝐬 𝐠𝐨𝐯𝐞𝐫𝐧𝐦𝐞𝐧𝐭.”But like any good tech product, you’ve got to read the fine print: “Terms and conditions apply.
